reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is based in two buildings we stayed in main building where they also have a small restaurant and bar. Location good but I would say you needed to walk into centre to find some good restaurants. I travelled with family inc 3yr old and 75yr old. Food in hotel was good and they also had bar if you wanted a drink, both of which were reasonable priced unlike most hotels. It's also near to a pub/bar sudo Irish with Guiness and TV for sports fans. Staff nice and friendly, secure car parking just up the rd, rooms pleasant. Main downside was TV /SAT didn't work well reported but not sorted. It is also connected to a pizzeria but you can order from the restaurant if you have a mix of dining requirements. Breakfast inc was fine some hot mainly continental. Excellent bread! I needed an extra bed for my 3yr old which was an air bed but fine. Shower needed the hook for the head good enough to feel refreshing without removing your skin. The other big bonus was being in the main building we were just below our room so we could leave 3yr old in bed and finish meal or have a nightcap and not worry. Literally under 30 seconds from room and you could see people coming and going, with only 4/5 rooms there it was fairly quiet.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Galija is a gem situated within walking distance of all of the major sights of Pula. It is about twenty minutes walking from both the bus and train stations. Our arrival though was not what we expected. We were given a very small room, so small as to be uncomfortable for the two of us. As well the bathroom smelled. My spouse immediately went back to the reception and they immediately changed our room to a much larger and more comfortable room overlooking the patio area. We were impressed with the immediacy of action by reception. Since we had arrived after the tourist office had closed, reception provided us with everything we needed – searching on the internet for bus schedules and other important information. The receptionist could not have been more helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to spend a few days in Pula. The location itself is very central and parking is provided for just 2 euro per day which is very useful given the narrow streets. The staff themselves are extremely friendly and helpful and the restaurant downstairs is very good.

reviews.text: The hotel appears to have been refurbished recently as the rooms are very clean and modern. There is also an added bonus of a beauty salon across the road which is attached to the hotel and where you can get a number of treatments at a very reasonable price! All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Nice hotel
reviews.text: Overall we liked this hotel, our room was small, but clean in the annexe across the road. Good air con and satellite TV worked fine. Beds were a bit "lumpy" however. The main member of staff that we came across was extremely friendly and cheery, spoke good English and was very helpful. The hotel has a car park for about 2 euros a day, it's quite big and only 2 minutes walk away, it's very secure as it has electronic gates. I agree with previous reviews about the poor standard of the breakfast, we found this to be pretty common across Croatia though. The food in the pizzeria attached to the annexe is very good though and extremely good value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Galija has an excellent location in busy Pula near all there is to see in town. This hotel is hidden on a side street just off the main drag. It is rated a 3 star (sometimes 4 star property), but it is really a 2 star with location going for it. We were housed in their annex accros the street. Our room was small and clean but very basic and a tough climb up three flights with two heavy cases. The beds were tiny and hard and the bathroom had a tub shower with only enough hot water for one guest; a problem when there are two of us! Staff at this hotel are plentiful but they seem to have little interest in the guests; we were never greeted or acknowledged as long as we stayed there. The breakfast provided is "slim pickings". A final note; Pula is a very busy town and parking is a problem. You need to be lucky to find a spot on the street near the hotel and lots are tough to find. We have a parking ticket to prove it.
